item.title: Ethernet over Copper FAQ
item.description: The number of business bandwidth choices has grown a lot lately. One popular newcomer is Ethernet over Copper (EoC). If you’re thinking about a new or renewed connectivity contract, check out these EoC FAQs. Q: What is Ethernet over Copper service? A: Ethernet over Copper (EoC) uses existing telephone lines to carry Ethernet signals. Basically, it extends your local network across cities and wider areas. Q: How does EoC compare to T1 lines?
